verses.verse: Now the Philistines<WH6430> gathered<WH622> together their armies<WH4264> to battle,<WH4421> and were gathered<WH622> together at Shochoh,<WH7755> which<WH834> belongs to Judah,<WH3063> and pitched<WH2583> between<WH996> Shochoh<WH7755> and Azekah,<WH5825> in Ephesdammim.<WH658>

And Saul<WH7586> and the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> were gathered<WH622> together,<WH3162> and pitched<WH2583> by the valley<WH6010> of Elah,<WH425> and set the battle<WH4421> in array<WH6186> against<WH7125> the Philistines.<WH6430>

And the Philistines<WH6430> stood<WH5975> on<WH413> a mountain<WH2022> on<WH413> the one<WH2088> side, and Israel<WH3478> stood<WH5975> on<WH413> a mountain<WH2022> on<WH413> the other<WH2088> side: and there was a valley<WH1516> between<WH996> them.

And there went<WH3318> out a champion<WH376> <WH1143> out of the camp<WH4264> of the Philistines,<WH6430> named<WH8034> Goliath,<WH1555> of Gath,<WH1661> whose height<WH1363> was six<WH8337> cubits<WH520> and a span.<WH2239>

And he had an helmet<WH3553> of brass<WH5178> on his head,<WH7218> and he was armed<WH3847> with a coat<WH8302> of mail;<WH7193> and the weight<WH4948> of the coat<WH8302> was five<WH2568> thousand<WH505> shekels<WH8255> of brass.<WH5178>
And he had greaves<WH4697> of brass<WH5178> on his legs,<WH7272> and a target<WH3591> of brass<WH5178> between<WH996> his shoulders.<WH3802>

And the staff<WH2671> of his spear<WH2595> was like a weaver's<WH707> beam;<WH4500> and his spear's<WH2595> head<WH3852> weighed six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of iron:<WH1270> and one bearing<WH5375> a shield<WH6793> went<WH1980> before<WH6440> him.

And he stood<WH5975> and cried<WH7121> to the armies<WH4634> of Israel,<WH3478> and said<WH559> to them, Why<WH4100> are you come<WH3318> out to set your battle<WH4421> in array?<WH6186> am not I a Philistine,<WH6430> and you servants<WH5650> to Saul?<WH7586> choose<WH1262> you a man<WH376> for you, and let him come<WH3381> down<WH3381> to me.

If<WH518> he be able<WH3201> to fight<WH3898> with me, and to kill<WH5221> me, then will we be your servants:<WH5650> but if<WH518> I prevail<WH3201> against him, and kill<WH5221> him, then shall you be our servants,<WH5650> and serve<WH5647> us.
And the Philistine<WH6430> said,<WH559> I defy<WH2778> the armies<WH4634> of Israel<WH3478> this<WH2088> day;<WH3117> give<WH5414> me a man,<WH376> that we may fight<WH3898> together.<WH3162>
When Saul<WH7586> and all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> heard<WH8085> those<WH428> words<WH1697> of the Philistine,<WH6430> they were dismayed,<WH2865> and greatly<WH3966> afraid.<WH3372>

Now David<WH1732> was the son<WH1121> of that Ephrathite<WH673> of Bethlehemjudah,<WH1035> whose name<WH8034> was Jesse;<WH3448> and he had eight<WH8083> sons:<WH1121> and the man<WH376> went<WH935> among men<WH582> for an old<WH2204> man in the days<WH3117> of Saul.<WH7586>

And the three<WH7969> oldest<WH1419> sons<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> went<WH3212> and followed<WH1980> <WH310> Saul<WH7586> to the battle:<WH4421> and the names<WH8034> of his three<WH7969> sons<WH1121> that went<WH1980> to the battle<WH4421> were Eliab<WH446> the firstborn,<WH1060> and next<WH4932> to him Abinadab,<WH41> and the third<WH7992> Shammah.<WH8048>
And David<WH1732> was the youngest:<WH3996> and the three<WH7969> oldest<WH1419> followed<WH1980> <WH310> Saul.<WH7586>
But David<WH1732> went<WH1980> and returned<WH7725> from Saul<WH7586> to feed<WH7462> his father's<WH1> sheep<WH6629> at Bethlehem.<WH1035>
And the Philistine<WH6430> drew near<WH5066> morning<WH7925> and evening,<WH6150> and presented<WH3320> himself forty<WH705> days.<WH3117>

And Jesse<WH3448> said<WH559> to David<WH1732> his son,<WH1121> Take<WH3947> now<WH4994> for your brothers<WH251> an ephah<WH374> of this<WH2088> parched<WH7039> corn, and these<WH2088> ten<WH6235> loaves,<WH3899> and run<WH7323> to the camp<WH4264> of your brothers;<WH251>

And carry<WH935> these<WH428> ten<WH6235> cheeses<WH2757> <WH2461> to the captain<WH8269> of their thousand,<WH505> and look<WH6485> how your brothers<WH251> fare,<WH7965> and take<WH3947> their pledge.<WH6161>
Now Saul,<WH7586> and they, and all<WH3605> the men<WH376> of Israel,<WH3478> were in the valley<WH6010> of Elah,<WH425> fighting<WH3898> with the Philistines.<WH6430>

And David<WH1732> rose<WH7925> up early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH1242> and left<WH5203> the sheep<WH6629> with a keeper,<WH8104> and took,<WH5375> and went,<WH3212> as Jesse<WH3448> had commanded<WH6680> him; and he came<WH935> to the trench,<WH4570> as the host<WH2428> was going<WH3318> forth<WH3318> to the fight,<WH4634> and shouted<WH7321> for the battle.<WH4421>
For Israel<WH3478> and the Philistines<WH6430> had put the battle in array,<WH6186> army<WH4634> against<WH7125> army.<WH4634>

And David<WH1732> left<WH5203> his carriage<WH3627> in the hand<WH3027> of the keeper<WH8104> of the carriage,<WH3627> and ran<WH7323> into the army,<WH4634> and came<WH935> and saluted<WH7592> <WH7965> his brothers.<WH251>

And as he talked<WH1696> with them, behold,<WH2009> there came<WH5927> up the champion,<WH376> <WH1143> the Philistine<WH6430> of Gath,<WH1661> Goliath<WH1555> by name,<WH8034> out of the armies<WH4630> of the Philistines,<WH6430> and spoke<WH1696> according to the same<WH428> words:<WH1697> and David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> them.
And all<WH3605> the men<WH376> of Israel,<WH3478> when they saw<WH7200> the man,<WH376> fled<WH5127> from him, and were sore<WH3966> afraid.<WH3372>

And the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> said,<WH559> Have you seen<WH7200> this<WH2088> man<WH376> that is come<WH5927> up? surely<WH3588> to defy<WH2778> Israel<WH3478> is he come<WH5927> up: and it shall be, that the man<WH376> who<WH834> kills<WH5221> him, the king<WH4428> will enrich<WH6238> him with great<WH1419> riches,<WH6239> and will give<WH5414> him his daughter,<WH1323> and make<WH6213> his father's<WH1> house<WH1004> free<WH2670> in Israel.<WH3478>

And David<WH1732> spoke<WH559> to the men<WH582> that stood<WH5975> by him, saying,<WH559> What<WH4100> shall be done<WH6213> to the man<WH376> that kills<WH5221> this<WH1975> Philistine,<WH6430> and takes<WH5493> away the reproach<WH2781> from Israel?<WH3478> for who<WH4310> is this<WH2088> uncircumcised<WH6189> Philistine,<WH6430> that he should defy<WH2778> the armies<WH4634> of the living<WH2416> God?<WH430>
And the people<WH5971> answered<WH559> him after this<WH2088> manner,<WH1697> saying,<WH559> So<WH3541> shall it be done<WH6213> to the man<WH376> that kills<WH5221> him.

And Eliab<WH446> his oldest<WH1419> brother<WH251> heard<WH8085> when he spoke<WH1696> to the men;<WH582> and Eliab's<WH446> anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> against David,<WH1732> and he said,<WH559> Why<WH4100> came<WH3381> you down<WH3381> here? and with whom<WH4310> have you left<WH5203> those<WH2007> few<WH4592> sheep<WH6629> in the wilderness?<WH4057> I know<WH3045> your pride,<WH2087> and the naughtiness<WH7455> of your heart;<WH3824> for you are come<WH3381> down<WH3381> that you might see<WH7200> the battle.<WH4421>
And David<WH1732> said,<WH559> What<WH4100> have I now<WH6258> done?<WH6213> Is there not a cause?<WH1697>

And he turned<WH5437> from him toward<WH413> <WH4136> another,<WH312> and spoke<WH559> after the same<WH2088> manner:<WH1697> and the people<WH5971> answered<WH7725> <WH1697> him again<WH7725> after the former<WH7223> manner.<WH1697>
And when the words<WH1697> were heard<WH8085> which<WH834> David<WH1732> spoke,<WH1696> they rehearsed<WH5046> them before<WH6440> Saul:<WH7586> and he sent<WH3947> for him.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> Let no<WH408> man's<WH120> heart<WH3820> fail<WH5307> because<WH5921> of him; your servant<WH5650> will go<WH3212> and fight<WH3898> with this<WH2088> Philistine.<WH6430>

And Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> You are not able<WH3201> to go<WH3212> against<WH413> this<WH2088> Philistine<WH6430> to fight<WH3898> with him: for you are but a youth,<WH5288> and he a man<WH376> of war<WH4421> from his youth.<WH5271>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> Your servant<WH5650> kept<WH7462> his father's<WH1> sheep,<WH6629> and there came<WH935> a lion,<WH738> and a bear,<WH1677> and took<WH5375> a lamb<WH7716> out of the flock:<WH5739>

And I went<WH3318> out after<WH310> him, and smote<WH5221> him, and delivered<WH5337> it out of his mouth:<WH6310> and when he arose<WH6965> against<WH5921> me, I caught<WH2388> him by his beard,<WH2206> and smote<WH5221> him, and slew<WH4191> him.

Your servant<WH5650> slew<WH5221> both<WH1571> the lion<WH738> and the bear:<WH1677> and this<WH2088> uncircumcised<WH6189> Philistine<WH6430> shall be as one<WH259> of them, seeing<WH3588> he has defied<WH2778> the armies<WH4634> of the living<WH2416> God.<WH430>

David<WH1732> said<WH559> moreover, The LORD<WH3068> that delivered<WH5337> me out of the paw<WH3027> of the lion,<WH738> and out of the paw<WH3027> of the bear,<WH1677> he will deliver<WH5337> me out of the hand<WH3027> of this<WH2088> Philistine.<WH6430> And Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> Go,<WH3212> and the LORD<WH3068> be with you.
And Saul<WH7586> armed<WH3847> David<WH1732> with his armor,<WH4055> and he put<WH5414> an helmet<WH6959> of brass<WH5178> on his head;<WH7218> also he armed<WH3847> him with a coat<WH8302> of mail.

And David<WH1732> girded<WH2296> his sword<WH2719> on his armor,<WH4055> and he assayed<WH2974> to go;<WH3212> for he had not proved<WH5254> it. And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> I cannot<WH3808> go<WH3212> with these;<WH428> for I have not proved<WH5254> them. And David<WH1732> put<WH5493> them off<WH5921> him.

And he took<WH3947> his staff<WH4731> in his hand,<WH3027> and chose<WH977> him five<WH2568> smooth<WH2512> stones<WH68> out of the brook,<WH5158> and put<WH7760> them in a shepherd's<WH7462> bag<WH3627> which<WH834> he had, even in a money;<WH3219> and his sling<WH7050> was in his hand:<WH3027> and he drew near<WH5066> to the Philistine.<WH6430>
And the Philistine<WH6430> came<WH3212> on and drew near<WH7126> to David;<WH1732> and the man<WH376> that bore<WH5375> the shield<WH6793> went before<WH6440> him.

And when the Philistine<WH6430> looked<WH5027> about,<WH5027> and saw<WH7200> David,<WH1732> he disdained<WH959> him: for he was but a youth,<WH5288> and ruddy,<WH132> and of a fair<WH3303> countenance.<WH4758>

And the Philistine<WH6430> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> Am I a dog,<WH3611> that you come<WH935> to me with staves?<WH4731> And the Philistine<WH6430> cursed<WH7043> David<WH1732> by his gods.<WH430>

And the Philistine<WH6430> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> Come<WH3212> to me, and I will give<WH5414> your flesh<WH1320> to the fowls<WH5775> of the air,<WH8064> and to the beasts<WH929> of the field.<WH7704>

Then said<WH559> David<WH1732> to the Philistine,<WH6430> You come<WH935> to me with a sword,<WH2719> and with a spear,<WH2595> and with a shield:<WH3591> but I come<WH935> to you in the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> the God<WH430> of the armies<WH4634> of Israel,<WH3478> whom<WH834> you have defied.<WH2778>

This<WH2088> day<WH3117> will the LORD<WH3068> deliver<WH5462> you into my hand;<WH3027> and I will smite<WH5221> you, and take<WH5493> your head<WH7218> from you; and I will give<WH5414> the carcasses<WH6297> of the host<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430> this<WH2088> day<WH3117> to the fowls<WH5775> of the air,<WH8064> and to the wild<WH2416> beasts<WH2416> of the earth;<WH776> that all<WH3605> the earth<WH776> may know<WH3045> that there is a God<WH430> in Israel.<WH3478>

And all<WH3605> this<WH2088> assembly<WH6951> shall know<WH3045> that the LORD<WH3068> saves<WH3467> not with sword<WH2719> and spear:<WH2595> for the battle<WH4421> is the LORD's,<WH3068> and he will give<WH5414> you into our hands.<WH3027>

And it came<WH1961> to pass, when<WH3588> the Philistine<WH6430> arose,<WH6965> and came,<WH3212> and drew near<WH7126> to meet<WH7125> David,<WH1732> that David<WH1732> hastened,<WH4116> and ran<WH7323> toward the army<WH4634> to meet<WH7125> the Philistine.<WH6430>

And David<WH1732> put<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> in his bag,<WH3627> and took<WH3947> there<WH8033> a stone,<WH68> and slang<WH7049> it, and smote<WH5221> the Philistine<WH6430> in his forehead,<WH4696> that the stone<WH68> sunk<WH2883> into his forehead;<WH4696> and he fell<WH5307> on his face<WH6440> to the earth.<WH776>

So David<WH1732> prevailed<WH2388> over<WH4480> the Philistine<WH6430> with a sling<WH7050> and with a stone,<WH68> and smote<WH5221> the Philistine,<WH6430> and slew<WH4191> him; but there was no<WH369> sword<WH2719> in the hand<WH3027> of David.<WH1732>

Therefore David<WH1732> ran,<WH7323> and stood<WH5975> on the Philistine,<WH6430> and took<WH3947> his sword,<WH2719> and drew<WH8025> it out of the sheath<WH8593> thereof, and slew<WH4191> him, and cut<WH3772> off his head<WH7218> therewith. And the men<WH582> of Israel<WH3478> and of Judah<WH3063> arose,<WH6965> and shouted,<WH7321> and pursued<WH7291> the Philistines,<WH6430> until<WH5704> you come<WH935> to the valley,<WH1516> and to the gates<WH8179> of Ekron.<WH6138> And the wounded<WH2491> of the Philistines<WH6430> fell<WH5307> down by the way<WH1870> to Shaaraim,<WH8189> even to Gath,<WH1661> and to Ekron.<WH6138>
And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> returned<WH7725> from chasing<WH1814> after<WH310> the Philistines,<WH6430> and they spoiled<WH8155> their tents.<WH4264>
And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> the head<WH7218> of the Philistine,<WH6430> and brought<WH935> it to Jerusalem;<WH3389> but he put<WH7760> his armor<WH3627> in his tent.<WH168>

And when Saul<WH7586> saw<WH7200> David<WH1732> go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> against<WH7125> the Philistine,<WH6430> he said<WH559> to Abner,<WH74> the captain<WH8269> of the host,<WH6635> Abner,<WH74> whose<WH4310> son<WH1121> is this<WH2088> youth?<WH5288> And Abner<WH74> said,<WH559> As your soul<WH5315> lives,<WH2416> O king,<WH4428> I cannot<WH518> tell.<WH3045>
And the king<WH4428> said,<WH559> Inquire<WH7592> you whose<WH4310> son<WH1121> the stripling<WH5958> is.
